contents:
最近看到幾篇跟著題目有關的論文，挺有意思的。

How the Chinese Government Fabricates Social Media Posts for Strategic Distraction, Not Engaged Argument By King, Pan, and Roberts (2017)

五毛存在的目的就是擾亂言論
We show that the goal of this massive secretive operation is instead to distract the

public and change the subject, as most of these posts involve cheerleading for China, the revolutionary history of the Communist Party, or other symbols of the regime. （emphasis added）


更有意思的是，他們很可能都是政府雇員。五毛的言論也有可能是他們工作的一部分。如果屬實，那麽他們的言論也只是工作的一部分，何來感情？還是那句，錢給夠了，膝蓋骨都會跪碎接旨。 

3. Identifying 50c Party Members. Next, most of the scholarly literature describes 50c party members as ordinary citizens hired for very low piecemeal wages.We found instead that almost all 50c workers in our sample are government employees ...

Indeed, no evidence exists that the authors of 50c posts are even paid extra for this work. We cannot be sure of current practices in the absence of evidence, but given that they already hold government and Chinese Communist Party jobs, we would guess that this activity is a requirement of their existing job or at least rewarded in performance reviews.（emphasis added）


如果還有興趣的話推薦看下那幾位作者的另一篇論文或者在youtube搜索 “哈佛大学 五毛报告"

Reverse-engineering censorship in China: Randomized experimentation and participant observation  By King, Pan, and  Roberts (2014)
